metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0464 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A security vulnerability has been identified in all supported versions ofOpenSSL related to the verification of X.509 certificate chains thatinclude policy constraints. Attackers may be able to exploit thisvulnerability by creating a malicious certificate chain that triggersexponential use of computational resources, leading to a denial-of-service(DoS) attack on affected systems. Policy processing is disabled by defaultbut can be enabled by passing the `-policy' argument to the command lineutilities or by calling the `X509_VERIFY_PARAM_set1_policies()' function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.1.1-1ubuntu2.1~18.04.22
openssl - 1.1.1-1ubuntu2.1~18.04.22
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.12
openssl1.0 - 1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.1-1ubuntu2.1~18.04.22').
openssl1.0 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.12').
nodejs package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
edk2 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
